instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> shorted.
threads.message: Board reads 0.005 short to ground in diode mode 4.99 ohms in resistance mode.  If I inject voltage, it draws a hair over 1 amp, but nothing gets hot.  CPU gets warm. Any pointers?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> shorted.
threads.message: CPU has no <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> connection. Do you mean the PCH is getting hot?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> shorted.
threads.message: Yes sir the PCH, my mistake.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> shorted.
threads.message: Yeah, if that is getting hot it is dead. If you are replacing it the BIOS will need fixing too, but only after you have at least an image on the LCD again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> shorted.
threads.message: Thanks, that ones going to the bottom of the pile.
